Hello,
that was a site I created a long time ago.  All our info on Nakajima=
 
Nobori is now here
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/nakajimabio.html
(images =
are offline because we are reorganizing the server right now) 
but you can =
still read his bio just fine.

I also made a tribute video to Nobori here:
=
http://1happyturtle.com/shinsengumi/NAKAJIMA_0001.wmv

This page:
http://ww=
w.shinsengumihq.com/nakajimastudio.html
has the rough translation of the im=
age you are referring as well as 
information on other paintings (Hirotada =
Tokugawa translated them). 
However that page was pulled offline for reform=
atting (basically we 
need to get the code a certain way to allow the datab=
ase to pick up 
keywords).  Sorry for the inconvenience everyone, but I hav=
e to take 
my orders from the programmer, she does the sophisticated stuff =
and 
do the grunt work.  I have asked her to keep pages online but she has =

a different work style etc etc

The painting is of Yamaguchi Jiro (we know=
 him as SAitou Hajime).  
Yamaguchi Jiro led the Shinsengumi in the defense=
 of Aizu.  Ofcourse 
Hijikata Toshizo was the official leader, however due =
to a foot 
injury Yamaguchi had to step up and take charge.  Later on after=
 
Hijikata and many SHinsengumi had to depart, Yamaguchi Jiro and a 
handfu=
l of Shinsengumi stayed behind.  Nakajima Nobori mentioned on 
the painting=
 that Yamaguchi Jiro had DIED in Aizu---this is ofcourse 
innaccurate (^_^)=
.  You see "Yama" (mountain) on his jacket.  
Yamaguchi Jiro later changes =
his name to Fujita Goro (his last name)

Nakajima Nobori's art is also now =
a tattoo!
CHECK IT OUT here:
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/cosplay.html
